revised_title: Phytoplankton Extracellular Product Release: Factors and Implications
tldr: The article investigates the release of dissolved organic material from phytoplankton populations and its relationship with environmental factors. It finds that extracellular release increases with decreasing population density and suggests that less productive waters have a higher relative release of extracellular products. The study also highlights the importance of considering extracellular products in productivity estimation methods.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
